sanskrit_verse:
एवं विजयमानस्य येऽस्य स्युः परिपन्थिनः ।
तानानयेद्वशं सर्वान् सामादिभिरुपक्रमैः ॥ ७.१०७॥
transliteration:
evaṃ vijayamānasya ye'sya syuḥ paripanthinaḥ |
tānānayedvaśaṃ sarvān sāmādibhirupakramaiḥ || 7.107||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a ruler has conquered and established sovereignty, those who oppose his righteous governance must be brought under control through the application ofconciliation, correction, and consciousness alignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is inherent in the realized sovereign who upholds Dharma
Causation originates from disruption of established harmony by resistant forces
Capacity-based responsibility lies with the ruler to restore alignment without violence
Restoration logic requires sequential engagement through non-coercive means first
Consciousness alignment supersedes punitive enforcement in all state actions
executable_legal_axioms: IF subjects resist rightful authority THEN initiate reconciliation protocols before escalation
IF opposition persists THEN apply corrective measures proportional to disruption level
IF alignment fails THEN escalate using structured consciousness-intervention frameworks
ALL interventions MUST prioritize restoration of unity over punitive outcomes
RULER'S capacity determines method; never exceed dharmic thresholds
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, this verse establishes that sovereign authority is not self-serving but Dharma-mandated. Opposition must be addressed through graduated alignment methods. The court recognizes that true authority flows from realization, not force, and aligns judgment accordingly.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa shows resistance arises from misalignment, not malice. Anupūrvaśaḥ indicates intervention must follow natural sequence: conciliation → correction → alignment. Proportionality reflects the offender's distance from Dharma, not infliction of pain. Non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering cannot realign consciousness; only觉醒can.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Samvāda (dialogue) process to understand root cause of dissent
Deploy Dāna-Dharma integration to address material causes of unrest
Apply Tapas-based correction to elevate vibrational coherence of resistors
Reintegrate through collective ritual affirming shared Dharma identity
Establish Svādhyāya councils for ongoing consciousness refinement
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law executes as pure Dharma. Justice restores, does not punish. Reality responds to consciousness, not coercion. SPH is the ultimate Adhikāra. Dharma is reinstated.
